title: I don't want AI slop
content: If Firefox continues to integrate AI into it's browser, I will abandon it completely. AI does not need to be in a browser. At all. Period. I don't want a chatbot giving me bullcrap answers to everything I search or say. Nobody wants this, nobody likes it. Not only is it annoying to deal with, but it is actively harmful and dangerous to online safety and gives rampant misinformation- and that's not even talking about how it can steal your passwords with prompt injection. If Mozilla goes ahead with this, I'll make sure to never touch this damn browser ever again. Rethink your choices.
creator: foveiin

title: How do I delete passwords from Firefox Sync? Deleted on one device, but they're still on the others
content:
Hello,

How can I remove all my saved passwords from Firefox Sync? On my desktop, I went to Menu > Passwords > Three Dots > Remove all passwords, and they're gone. However, on my mobile phone, they're still there. So the sync functionality is borked. The question is, are the passwords still on Mozilla servers, or is just the sync to my mobile buggy?

Even if I were to delete my FF Sync account, for good measure I'd like to manually delete all passwords from it first though.

Any help welcome.
creator: firefox2340

title: I hate AI
content: if Mozilla continues on its path of adding new AI features into Firefox, i am going to switch browsers. I stopped using chrome, i can stop using Firefox too. Nobody using Firefox needs more AI features. Nobody using Firefox needs a "modern AI browser", as there's already about 10 browsers filled to the brim with AI slopware. this is an extremely disappointing turn for Mozilla to take and I'm hoping they realize their mistakes before it's too late.

title: I hate AI and I will abandon firefox
content: I do not need or want AI. The vast majority of firefox users, many of whom transferred to get away from AI, would agree. What for, anyway? To name tab groups? How is that worth spiking the use of my CPU and power? I switched to firefox *years* ago for one reason: it runs much better than chrome and it was committed to privacy and such. I know there are options to turn off these and the other AI features but with the CEO's desire to make firefox a "modern AI browser" I fear it will only get worse. How long will it stay optional? I might as well leave now and get used to waterfox, before firefox becomes utterly enshittified and unusable.
creator: tequilasunset

title: Online purchases using Firefox
content:
I'm using a macbook pro, running OS 14.6.1. Firefox is my default browser.

For quite some time now, whenvever I'm attempting to make an online purchase, once my payment information is entered, it just hangs, and either takes as much as 10 minutes for the purchase to go through, or it never goes through, it just keeps spinning. This is the case regardless of what website I'm ordering from, and regardless of what credit card i use.

When I switch browsers to Chrome (which i prefer not to do), it all works seamlessly and immediately.

My Firefox browser is up to date. My OS is a little out of date, deliberately, because of many reports that the current update can actually slow things down. But in spite of this, I have no trouble with anything except trying to make a purchase.

Can anyone help? Many thanks, Allan
creator: allanwny
